title: The Bachelorette SPOILER: Ciarran Stott is pictured in Bali with his ex-girlfriend
text:
It appears that The Bachelorette's Ciarran Stott doesn't win Angie Kent's heart.

Despite being a fan favourite on the Channel 10 dating show, the hunk reunited with on-again off-again ex-girlfriend Renee Barrett in August after filming wrapped.

In one of the photographs, Ciarran is seen cosying up next to Renee, who starred on Matt Agnew's season of The Bachelor, over a romantic dinner in Bali.

Spoiler alert! Pictures have emerged of The Bachelorette's Ciarran Stott (left) reuniting with ex-girlfriend Renee Barrett (right) in Bali in August, proving he doesn't win the show

Not so subtle! Renee, who briefly starred on Matt Agnew's season of The Bachelor, shared the pictures to her Instagram Story but attempted to disguise Ciarran's face in each of them

In another picture, Ciarran is seen posing alongside Renee and a group of friends as they enjoyed a group trip to the Indonesian island.

The pictures, which seemingly reveal Ciarran leaves The Bachelorette a single man, were initially shared by Renee, who had attempted to cover his face.

Renee put a black heart over his face in one picture, scribbled over it in another and then used a beer tap to conceal Ciarran in a third.

However, Ciarran's distinguishable tattoos, which are still visible, revealed his identity, with him now even sporting a full neck of inkings.

'Happy': In this selfie, taken in August shortly after filming for The Bachelorette ended, Renee scribbled over the tattooed hunk's face

Earlier this month, a source told Daily Mail Australia that Ciarran only applied for the show because Renee appeared on Matt Agnew's season of The Bachelor.

'As soon as he found out she'd been cast on Matt's season and was about to start filming, he decided to get on The Bachelorette,' said the insider.

'Casting producers were aware of this and it definitely helped his cause. His friends are saying he mostly went on to get back at Renee.'

There's no hiding those! In this group photograph, Renee covered Ciarran's face (top, right) along with other male friends, but the star's distinguishable tattoos gave the game away

Renee and Ciarran, who both live in the Northern Territory, are understood to have split before either of them applied for the dating franchise.

Sadly, Renee's journey on The Bachelor was short lived as she was one of the first women sent home by astrophysicist Matt.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel 10 for comment.

Rivals! Earlier this month, a source told Daily Mail Australia that Ciarran only applied for the show because Renee appeared on Matt Agnew's season of The Bachelor
description: It appears that The Bachelorette's Ciarran Stott doesn't win Angie Kent's heart.
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
